thinking.disposable_income: Median household income is $66,797, with about 37.7% households earning less than $50,000. This suggests moderate disposable income but significant portion of population may be cost-sensitive
thinking.discretionary_consumption: Given the income distribution and household sizes (average 2.7), many families likely have limited discretionary spending capacity. Higher taxes and fees would impact consumption significantly
thinking.accessibility: Car ownership is high (83.2% have at least one vehicle) with 58.2% driving alone to work. Transit usage is moderate at 22.3%. This suggests good car accessibility but also significant transit dependence
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritize lower sales tax (0.5%) due to significant cost-sensitive population. 2. Balance moderate transit fares ($1.25) to maintain service quality while keeping accessible. 3. Support moderate driving fees ($0.50) to improve transit without overly burdening drivers. 4. Focus on proposals that reduce transit travel time since 22.3% use transit. 5. Consider proposals that maintain reasonable car travel times since majority drive
